DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/site not participating indicator whether consent or permission was obtained from a person to allow the removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the consent or permission from a person to allow the removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/site not participating indicator related to the consent of a person to allow the collection of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

PermissibleValues.value: Not applicable, patient less than 18 years old
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patient Less Than Eighteen Year Old Not Applicable

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patient Less Than Eighteen Year Old Not Applicable
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than seventeen and less than nineteen and the quantity that it denotes.: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.: Not new, of an earlier time.: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than seventeen and less than nineteen and the quantity that it denotes.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
Not new, of an earlier time.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient's initial consent given for an additional diagnostic biopsy for research on future studies

ReferenceDocuments.name: I agree biopsies may be done
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree biopsies may be done to obtain research specimens.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to use of skin sample (from rash biopsy) for research testing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must be willing and able to undergo a pre-surgery biopsy and wait 2 weeks before their debulking surgery

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has agreed to have new biopsy done and has given permission to use biopsy specimen sample(s) and related information.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has agreed to have a new biopsy collected before starting the study drug and has given permission to use his/her specimen sample(s) and related information.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have three (3) biopsies to obtain fresh tumor tissue samples and to have their tumor samples used for the purposes described in the consent form?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has agreed to have a biopsy collected 6 weeks after starting the study drugs and has given permission to use his/her specimen sample(s) and related information.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has agreed to have an extra biopsy collected before starting the study drug and to have an extra biopsy collected after stopping the study drug, and has given permission to use his/her specimen sample(s) and related information.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has agreed to undergo a new biopsy if the amount of tissue at diagnosis is not enough for the genomic testing.

ReferenceDocuments.name: OPEN
ReferenceDocuments.description: I agree to have one or two research biopsies to collect tissue for known laboratory research studies.

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
